short_summary: Contract for the delivery of a requirement detailed in the bid solicitation for the stratospheric balloon program
description: This is a notice of proposed procurement for a requirement that is limited for bidding among firms registered on the Inuit Firm Registry (IFR). The Canadian Space Agency (CSA) would like to fly a scientific gondola under a stratospheric balloon from Sweden that would land on Baffin Island following a transatlantic flight. The flight is planned to last 3-5 days (between June 15th and June 30th 2024) depending on wind speed in the stratosphere.
full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement
### Logistics and Recovery Services for Stratospheric Balloon Mission in Nunavut 2024

**Reference Number:** cb-339-50090421
**Solicitation Number:** 9F064-23-0467/A

**Assistance to Inuit Businesses Required:** The Canadian Space Agency (CSA) requires the assistance of Inuit businesses to participate in this procurement process. For more information on registering on the Inuit Firm Registry, please visit the Nunavut Tunngavik Inc. website ([https://www.tunngavik.com/contact-us/](https://www.tunngavik.com/contact-us/)).

**Notice of Proposed Procurement:**

The Canadian Space Agency invites bids from Inuit businesses registered on the Inuit Firm Registry for the provision of logistics and recovery services for a stratospheric balloon mission in Nunavut 2024. The mission involves the flight of a scientific gondola under a stratospheric balloon from Sweden, which will land on Baffin Island following a transatlantic flight.

**Duration:** The contract will commence upon award and is expected to last until July 31, 2024.

**Procurement Details:**

* **Category:** SRV (services)
* **Method:** Competitive - Selective tendering
* **Evaluation Criteria:** Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price
* **Trade Agreements:** None
* **Regions of Opportunity:** Canada
* **Regions of Delivery:** Nunavut Territory, Iqaluit

**Requirements:**

* Provision of logistics and recovery services for the stratospheric balloon mission
* Delivery of a scientific gondola under a stratospheric balloon from Sweden to Baffin Island
* Inclusion of a payload designed by youth who attended the Makigiaqta Inuit Training Corporation's Science Career Camp in Cambridge Bay

**How to Participate:**

To participate in this procurement process, suppliers must be registered on the Inuit Firm Registry and meet the requirements specified in the solicitation documentation. The solicitation documentation can be accessed at: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/39250/please-contact-the-contracting-officer-to-get-the-full-solicitation-documentation.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/39250/please-contact-the-contracting-officer-to-get-the-full-solicitation-documentation
